comments.author: @Gypsyx
comments.text: Alcohol is more of a social thing for me. I wouldn't come home from work and head to the fridge for a cold beer like some people. But in a social setting I usually do drink. Drugs aren't always bad. Some people like to smoke weed. I don't smoke but I don't think there's anything wrong with it either. These things aren't always necessarily bad for us unless we take in too much. But that's anything in life.

comments.author: @Immortality
comments.text: IDK if this applies to ur disease, but I know for my old disease (cured mofo) smoking apparently had positive effects. They called it a "non smokers disease". Now I couldn't smoke for 40 years to avoid flares bcuz I would just get lung cancer so that does me no good, but evidently that's the one time cigarettes were beneficial. Also, with alcohol I would HIGHLY recommend you nvr drink that with crohns but while I was on Remicade I had a blast getting plastered LMFAO! We went to this crazy party with cheerleaders one time and since I only knew my one friend and we were surrounded by hot girls I got super drunk :P The feeling of getting drunk is so weird and good, but then a few hrs later u feel super depressed and will think about crazy things. Oh, and I drunk texted my one girl friend and told her my intestines were leaking blood and I was dying and to save me trololololol. The next day i got yelled at cuz she said she was so worried about me :(
